learning_outcomes.description: demonstrate an understanding of the concept of cultural heritage
discuss new directions in cultural heritage management
demonstrate an understanding of the basic steps required in planning for cultural heritage management
demonstrate an understanding of the basic steps in preparing heritage management plans and impact statements for cultural heritage places

assessments.task_description:
Students will complete one online quiz within a set timeframe. The quiz will consist of 3 shorts answer questions worth 5% each. A time limit will be set and you must complete the quiz within that time. 

The quiz will cover week 1 to 7.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assessments will be completed online through Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
You will form groups of 4 to 5 students to create a heritage impact assessment report for a proposed development in Brisbane. Further details of this assessment will be made available on Blackboard.

In addition, you will be asked to assess the contribution made by your fellow group members to the assessment task using a peer assessment tool. Those students who do not make a satisfactory contribution to the work may be marked down.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets required.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
In addition to the Heritage Impact Assessment Report, your group will give a 10 minutes PowerPoint in-person summarising the findings of your assessment.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: The exam will cover lectures from weeks 1 - 11 and will consist of both MCQs and short answer questions. This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
